description:
please add

- app icon should change date
- add event button in clock widget
- add event in app right click menu

- google tasks

Calendar used to work in Ubuntu 22.04 and 23.10 but doesn't in Ubuntu 24.04 now.

Doesn't send any notifications for Calendar events that are scheduled.

Was a deb before but now a Flatpak

works great as a basic callendar, my only wizh for this app now is to be able to have the calendar apps across linux devices be able to sync, that way my partner could edit our calendar and it would automatically change it for me too.
ojh4g908hfjx3miu9kcvr,ihejreioxkuibcjreofjmfkvc,mdejkvmwo
I really like the idea of this tool to replace the Evolution calendar. However, it still needs at least a "per-day" view in order to be a serious contender.

The intergration with online accounts works as it should. The UI is nice and clean and doesn't get in your way, which is a bonus. The only downside is the missing "week" view, but that's going to be fixed soon, or so I've been told.

The search bar really stands out here. It's fast and accurate, which is new for me in calendars. Most searches in other calendars return events not related to what I'm searching, but not this one.
summary: Great tool, does what it needs to do.

description: Easy to use. Clean and straight-forward interface.
I love that it integrates with my online accounts.

Generally a very well designed app. Very intuitive, simple and stylish.
However the lack of a Week and List View is a major drawback. Additionally the integration with the gnome shell should be way better: if you use the top-middle calendar you should be able to switch to the app!

All in all useable, but lacks some features.
The most beautiful app for Gnome. However still misses the week-view.

After working with various calendars over the years, I've always found them to have too much to be really useful. Not only does this integrate extremely well into the desktop the way a calendar should; It lets me know exactly what I need, fast, cleanly and easily. A pleasure on the eyes and the brain. There is definitely a part of me that pretends I need more, but over the long run I need something that works. A repeat function for dates would be good but not a deal-breaker.
summary: The calendar I have been looking for

description: I think that this application is a cool thing but there is one thing not included: a week overview.

This will be good enough for simple things, but you'll need to use something else if you want repeating events, the ability to invite others. It has a field for location, which I hope will soon open up in Maps. Otherwise, I'm looking forward to week/day/agenda views.

I've been using this calendar since its initial implementation and it has been a very useful tool as it integrates nicely with the GNOME desktop environment and ownCloud.  I would like to see the addition of a day and weekly view and possibly the syncing of Gnome-ToDo (tasks).
summary: A Nice Calendar for GNU/Linux Users

description: It's a nice simple calendar that works well with my nextcloud server, and works well with google calendars.
I cant change pm and am or set the format 24 for time
I really like the integration with the desktop clock on Fedora 25. Works well with my outlook.com calendar.
summary: Plays well with the GNOME desktop

description: I have to say that i am not big on calendaring and i am an Evolution user and this is why i uninstall GNOME Calendar after setting up Fedora Workstation, That being said GNOME Calendar is getting better and better and one day i may be tempted to actually use it.
The best free calendar I ever had.
I'm a bit concerned about those sizes, so I couldn't keep it.
It's better if you add alternative calendar like islamic hijri etc
good daily usable app, looking forward to future development
Every attempt to add a web calendar with authentication crashes the application, with no output appearing in the terminal log
I love this app, but my shared calendar (importer from an external URL) from my Google account does not appear :(

I really like the idea and design behind this calendar. It's very simple and neat. That being said, the development seems almost dead. Several months ago, a giant bug appeared. Events would jump back and forth between dates when editing. The calendar was completely useless. Many people had it reported. Several MONTHS later, the bug was STILL NOT FIXED, which is incredible! It's probably fixed by the time you read this, but what happens next time such a bug appears?
summary: Modern and simple design with horrible bugs

description: Features missing, unintuitive interface, sometimes simple things get overcomplicated. I prefer the web version at https://calendar.google.com
summary: Not as good as Google Calendar

description:
This is probably one of the worst calendar apps. It claims a simple design but really it is a stupid design. You can not even invite others to an event, and if you can, then it is certainly not clear or intuitive.

Ugh...

This is a fairly straightforward thing to accomplish - eg https://posteo.de:8443/calendars/example/default/ put in the calendar's address Thunderbird etc set up in a flash but nil points here. just get a red streak going across and that's it.
summary: Won't sync with posteo online account

description: It contains the basic features of a calendar app, but Google Calendar is way better.

No extras and probably of limited use for those with complicated lives and diaries, but it works well for those who want to run a uncomplicated paperless calendar and are not looking to syncretise appointments across several devices. I find its simplicity is a bit of a tonic.
The calendar works as a calendar just fine, as long as you're not looking for any advanced features. I was disappointed that I could not subscribe to a Facebook calendar.
Thank you for your hard work
It will pull down online Google Calendar data but does not upload from the app. It does not properly sync.
summary: Does Not Sync With Google Calendar

description: A good looking, easy to use calendar application. Integration with Exchange, NextCloud, etc. is very easy. Usage is intuitive.

Everything works fine but I would like to Import my Gmail calendar events.
Anyway to do this?
Easy set-up. To sync with an online calendar I just had to add that account to the "online accounts" section of settings and BANG!
summary: Easy to sync to Google calendar

description:
Doesn't work well with default dark theme, small font to event names.
Maybe could get some inspiration on Google Calendars to improve his interface.
loved how the calendar writes the Azeri language version of Thursday instead of Persian (which I have set it to)
IT WORK OK JUST CAN'T MOVE TO OTHER OR PRINT TO SAVE IN FO.
summary: HOW DO YOU BACK UP CAL OR IN PORT TO OTHER CAL. ?

description: The design is pretty, but it comes at the cost of many features. e.g. no option for personalization. Also, when importing calendars, it imports the times wrong. Had to go through a lot of stress realizing all of my appointments have been shifted by 2 hours!
summary: Lacks many features and doesn't work

description:
Suggestions for future updates

Include a Dark Theme Mode

View and edit, even on the go

Sync your schedule across platforms and devices, so you’re never without it

Toggle from day, week, and month view so you always know what’s next

Update events in real time, with no broken links or outdated information

Sync events automatically from E-mail 

See upcoming events from your email without lifting a finger

Have all the important info handy when you need it

RSVP to event invitations right from your inbox

Plan for your goals with repeat scheduling

Set goals that matter to you—and reach them

Create reminders for time-sensitive tasks

See your goals and reminders right alongside your daily schedule

Make scheduling easy with smart suggestions

Save time by seeing when your team is available to meet

Quickly schedule meetings with suggested guests, titles and times

Add convenient rooms for you and your teammates, no matter what office they sit in

Connect and collaborate with your team, using an Office App suite— (example LibreOffice)

use Calendar with Health apps to track your workouts and mark Goals as done automatically.
summary: Good Calendar plenty of Room for Improvement

description: It has no RSVP awareness, so I can't tell from looking if the upcoming event is even one that I'm attending. Has no awareness of other people. It's too barebones to be useful. I don't know what I would use this for. Nothing, I guess. Best of luck with its continued development.
Perfect for me. I wanted simple, with no extras. Just something the same as the paper calendar I used for years.
summary: Simple Calendar. Exactly what I was looking for.

description:
the UI is nice, clean and reactive.
it integrates with Google calendar seamlessly

Evolution was too convoluted for my no-share calendaring needs. Still, I wanted a way to track my personal appointments on the Gnome top bar calendar, and the standard install of Gnome Calendar (NOT the snap, of which so many don't work!) is integrating with GNOME shell just as I'd hoped.
Can't add any events. Buttons not working. Pretty useless.
Looks great, fits in with the system. It needs an agenda view in it though.

GNOME Calendar, along with GNOME Contacts and Tasks, will not work without GNOME Evolution as they all rely on Evolution's Exchange add-on, defeating their purpose.

I'd like to be able to just have Calendar etc. without having to install Evolution - Calendar etc. should all be able to get the Exchange add-on for its self.

Using UK calendar it display in wrong cell.

If I create a manual entry the same happens.

If I run from 0001 to 2359 it displays correctly.

This calendar cannot be relied upon - clearly not tested on year boundaries.
summary: Presents New Years Day on 1st December!

description:
If you're using the Gnome DE it's easy to get Monday first. 

Open Settings > Region & Language > Formats. 

Pick the country you're from.

>
enter an event on 'March 1st 2020' - no repeat, no reminder.

...now go back to Feb, Jan, Dec .. and you will notice that the event is on all previous months !

The crazy things is, if you flick back and forward between months, you will notice the entry jumps from the 1st of the month, to the 29th... and sometimes to the 2nd !

+ I have reported this glitch, but as far as my confidence for this app goes... well jesus H, I am never using it again!

UNBELIEVABLE! ... this is either on purpose or just pure negligence! 

THIS IS UNBELIEVABLE!
summary: Do this test, and YOU WILL BE SHOCKED HOW BAD THIS APP IS

description: wants permission to read, compose,sent and deleted all mails for gmail and google drive ... are you **** kidding me
unable to adjust for more logical notion of chronological depiction of time
Lack of printing makes this program pretty useless
button Add remains inactive. sometimes it asks for some strange credentials
summary: cannot add calendart from web link

description: Slow and inadequate for my needs.

Widgets are sized wrong (date widget doesn't even fit a typical value). Widget default values are brain-dead stupid. Like why default to 00:00 in the morning to start an event?

Regressions like: https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gnome-calendar/issues/548.
summary: Ultra basic and ultra buggy. GNOME team typical

description: Indeed, I couldn't synchronize my existing calendars, other version of GNOME calendar work better.

I like the minimal design, but there are plenty (critical) bugs: (1) random crashes (2) editing of an event resulted in deletion of that event (3) not able to delete single events of an event series (4) a few minor bugs, decreasing user experience.

I like the fact that's it's simple and clean. I think the sync feature would require some work, I'm not exactly sure when it syncs (but it doesn't seem like it's very frequent). Using nextcloud for syncs.

It's broken. Adding a new event doesn't always work.
It's feature-less. There's not even a menu for changing preferences.

Perfectly minimal. A few reviewers have negatively reviewed that this calendar does not have any settings of its own. That is true, but because it picks up its settings from the OS configuration (what day of the week is the start, timezone, online accounts, etc.).
Nice and clean interface. Great user experience.
looks nice but then I cannot even create an event.
no way to show day of the week or change the day of the week.
summary: Needs to list day of the week

description:
Events and reminders from google calendar are not syncing with app and via versa on Unity desktop.
After some research and debugging, I really don't recommend this app, to much complications, save your time and use something else or just web version.
summary: Sync with Google Calendar not working

description:
Unfortunately calendar doesn't act like I'm used to. Things that already have been implemented by everybody else look like another universe comparing to this particular app.

Cons:
- No accept/decline/maybe button
- Meetings links from description are not clickable
- I see "done" if I didn't change anything
- Timezones do not work at all (if I have event created in different timezone the time I see is considered to be my local, not converted to my local time)

Pros:
- Good news are: the weather is working. At least something, thank you!
This is a good app.
Not usable with Nextcloud
Has everything i want

I oftenly used Calendar on Ubuntu 18.04 because of 	the syncronization between e-mails' calendars and it works kind of stable (sometimes it delays a bit). Now on 20.04 I cannot edit my events without the app crashing and closing. Please fix it! As a native Ubuntu application it is really good and it'd be a shame stop using it.
summary: Crashes everytime I edit one event

description: sucks doesn't work can't add calendar google calendar only way to go take this off of ubuntu apps until it can be fixed
Sycn with google account not working in my ubuntu Budgie-unity
Nothing really sticks out about this calendar application on Pure OS, but it works and it's clean and fits the Gnome desktop very well.
The app is ok but compared to other calendar apps like osmo, this one doesn't always work from distro to distro. Unless you are on the bleeding edge and GNOME based distro, use Osmo or Evoloution.
It works as it should, but there are not many settings or options. It's easier to just use google calendar in a web browser.

We use GSuite. I've set up my online accounts correctly, but Calendar doesn't show anything. All google calendars and events show fine in Evolution, so my online account is set up correctly. Would love to get this standalone calendar working.
Not able to log in to MS acount
Like most Linux utilities, this one is a stupid toy compared to the Win10 calendar in their Mail app.
simple calendar but would like to have a few more features.
summary: works good with Ubuntu 20.04 and nextcloud

i f i had known of this feature, i would not have added and add o i thunderbrd.

i think this i ilke this app
Unfortunately the app keeps crashing in Ubuntu 20.04. Usually when I try to open the calendar overview. Keeping it because I can't find a good alternative.
Sometimes crush, not fully intuitive UI/UX.
Sometimes slow but it works fine.
Clean UI, integration with Google Calendar.
google calendars keep getting disconnected
Crashes when selecting calendars

Can't remove calendars that USED to be in Google, shows all my caldars two times. Completely not user friendly. I only gave it a two start becuase the few things it can do it does very well. Not enough for me to keep using it though.

I want to like this app, as it's quite modern and attractive. That being said, it is full of fatal bugs. It cannot reliably sync calendars with Google Calendars, it only supports all-day events due to the fact that you cannot set an end time without it automatically and spitefully readjusting the start time (usually the date as well).

Skip it, unless you don't care about your appointments.
For one day, my google calendar was synced. The next day, it was gone. Everytime I try to sync, the app crashes. Hope this gets fixed.
no claendars shows up and it crashes

I can't create a biweekly schedule. Pretty straight forward to do. I want event A to occur BIWEEKLY on the following days; SATURDAY & SUNDAY, Event B to occur WEEKLY on the following days; MONDAYS & TUESDAYS.
cant change date and time to my state
nice, smooth, good
It has done exactly what I wanted from it so far

Gnome should start taking this seriously. As a programmer, I am on the verge of ditching Linux altogether, because I can't keep track of my appointments like a grownup. This is the best integrated calendar in all of Linux, but it's still awful. 

Especially during quarantine, every appointment I have has a meeting of some sort attached to it. Calendar doesn't make accessing the website attribute easy. At best, I can make it a comment, then copy and paste it and open a browser, and paste it.

Please Gnome, you guys are really dropping the ball here.You gotta focus on this and drop these pie-in-the-sky ideas like maps.
Syncing reliability is flaky at best

Previous version was syncing with my Google Calendars set up through the system online accounts controls. It no longer works with that. It does appear to still work properly with my private Owncloud/Nextcloud installation
summary: This update 3.36.2-0ubuntu1 breaks Google Calendar Syncing..

description: I can not even add more than four events without getting the app crashed. It definitely needs more development and work from the programmers

Leider noch keine Gruppen...
aber was noch nicht ist....

Seit der heutigen Aktualisierung unbrauchbar. Wieder mal wurde ein brauchbares Programm zu Tode aktualisiert. Meine Online-Kalender werden nicht mehr angezeigt, und außerdem ist alles plötzlich auf Englisch.

The application has potential, but there are a few minor things which would be great in daily use:

- dont preasume a new meeting for the whole day, it usually is just a couple of hours go with a hour as duration
- offer possibility for sync-time settings or sync more frequently or after every apply of a new meeting or manual
summary: Good but could be better in daily use

description: Es hat aber auch Fehler. Z.B. wenn aus einer Serie ein Termin gelöscht wird, ist er gleich wieder da. (Bei mir: Google Kalender)

...zeigt nur die Hälfte aller verfügbaren Nextcloud-Kalender an. Je nach Tagesform sind in der Kalender-Verwaltung entweder nur diese oder gar keine zu sehen. So wird das leider nichts. Hallo & willkommen Thunderbird Lightning!

leider sehe ich nicht wo man feiertage und ferienkalender importieren kann.
diese funktionalität ist bei einer jahresplanung unabdinglich.
summary: gute bedienung und schöne optik, aber

description: Sieht hübsch aus, versucht sich aber bei CalDav noch während der Eingabe anzumelden, obwohl Adresse nicht fertig eingegeben. Wenn Adresse fertig, keine Anmeldung, keine Reaktion auf Enter. Somit unnütz für mich, gelöscht.
Extrem Fehlerhaft!
summary: Stürzt immer ab wenn ich einen Termin erstellen möchte

description:
1. Keine Feiertage 
2. Kein Speichern/ Sichern möglich das ist sehr magelhaft

Eine schöne kleine Kalender-Applikation mit Luft nach oben. Die Gruppen können verwendet werden, wenn man mit einem CalDAV o. ä. Server (wie NextCloud) arbeitet.
Ich habe vermisst, dass ich Personen zu Terminen einladen kann, aber das kommt bestimmt noch.
summary: Doch Gruppen... aber nur von CalDAV oder anderen Kalender-Servern

description: Leider funktioniert, bei Serienterminen, das Progrmm oft fehlerhaft. Auch die Rubrik Geburtstage/Jahrestage kann bei mir nicht aktiviert werden. Hoffe wird b ald verbessert..

Gab's in Ubuntu 16.
Daher nur 3 Sterne
summary: Ich brauche die Anzeige der Kalenderwoche

description: Nach einem Update leider kein Zugriff mehr auf den Online-Kalender
Schade, leider lässt sich der Kalender nicht mher benutzen. Online-Konten werdenerden nicht mehr angezeigt.
Onlinekonten werden zwar verbunden, aber nicht angezeigt.
...und der Kalender ist leider damit nutzlos. Und nein, ich habe vorher keine Dateien oder Ordner manuell gelöscht oder Anwendungen deinstalliert.

Ich nutze den Kalender besonders wegen seiner guten Integration mit Gnome. Ein gut integrierter Desktop ist viel wert. Anfangs war ich auch begeistert von der reduzierten Darstellung, die mittlerweile nicht mehr Standard ist.

Leider stell ich aber immer wieder fest, dass Fehler auftreten, seltsame Effekte bei sich wiederholenden Terminen, Termine in Google Kalender richtig dargestellt werden aber in der Anwendung falsch, und dass die Formulare so nutzerunfreundlich sind, dass ich regelmäßig die gleichen Eingabefehler mache.

Abstürze sind an der Tagesordnung, auch wieder besonders bei sich wiederholenden Terminen im Google Kalender.

Übertragung meiner Termine aus orage ist nicht möglich.
Anzeige der Kalenderwoche in der Monatsanzeige nicht möglich.

Mir fehlt wie überall in Ubuntu, dass man eine Info aufrufen kann in der steht:
1. Programmname, den man auch ins Terminal zum starten eingeben kann.
2. Der Ort wo die Daten und Konfiguration abgespeichert werden.

Und der Akustische Alarm und Popup funktioniert leider nicht. Aber es ist sehr gut brauchbar wenn man auf den kleinen Punkt neben der Uhrzeit achtet.

La interfaz es excelente, justo un calendario de escritorio que puedes conectar con tu cuenta de Google y otras para que tengas acceso visual a los eventos de la semana, mes o año; muy recomendable. Me encantó.
Me gusta porque puedo mirar mi calendario de Google sin necesidad de ir a la web.
No puedo establecer el calendario de Google como predeterminado, se autodesactiva la casilla.
NO me funciona , desistalando

description: el calendario aparece por defecto con un listado de fiestas de santos y virgenes que a mi entender debería ser opcional su incorporación y no cargar el calendario con festividades religiosas que quizá no interesen por no tener efectos laborales en el ámbito del usuario

Por lo demás, cumple con su función.
es sencillo. fácil de usar. es recomendable.

It's aesthetically pleasing, but I can't connect it to my Google account, therefore I can't use it.

Se sincronizó automáticamente con mi cuenta de Google y me tira todos mis recordatorios, alertas, etc.
Estoy en Ubuntu 20.04
Debería de sincronizarse los colores de los eventos que se ponen en Google Calendar, para tener todos los eventos más organizados.
Una de las mejores aplicaciones de calendario para ubuntu, ademas se sincroniza con Google Calendar, lastima que los colores que le pongas al evento no los acepta la aplicacion.
Dispone de muy pocas opciones

description: me funciona muy bien, me gusta que es sencilla y fácil de usar

Se integra muy bien con el calendario de Google
Se integra perfecto con los múltiples calendarios de mis cuentas
puedes añadir tus cuentas de google y se sincronizan automáticamente

No queda claro como configurar correctamente para sincronizar exactamente lo que quieres.

Se sincroniza con google etc etc. pero en mi Ubuntu 20.04 tengo un bug i es que al ver el calendario semanalmente desaparecen las filas correspondientes a cada hora y minuto y por tanto no lo puedo usuar debidamente.
Es muy bueno que se sincronice con mi cuenta de google. Le faltaría en la vista anual los días de la semana en cada mes, para gusto mío.

no me deja personalizar los dias que quiero que me notifique.

Usaba el de google, pero no tiene modo oscuro, y me parece molesto para la vista. Este calendario tiene modo oscuro, y a nivel estético está genial: simple, minimalista, tiene todo. Acabo de descubrir que puedo crear categorías y darle colores a cada ítem que creo. Le doy 5 estrellas.

En Ubuntu 22.04 me funciona en Xorg, pero no en Wayland.
Does what it needs to, fast and without ever getting in my way, this is the best agenda app I've ever used.

L'app offre toutes les fonctionnalités basiques dans un très bon design, c'est top.
Juste un petit bémol, il manque la fonction de partage d'évènements (invités), sinon il fonctionne très bien avec un serveur ical maison (baikal avec yunohost).
Simple et efficace, largement compatible, prise en main très rapide et intuitive je recommande.

mieux que de stresser sur l'agenda d'evolution et d'attendre qu'il s'ouvre.
mais c'est trop sommaire ; sauf erreur de ma part il n'y pas les fonctions de repetition d'evenement , du style repeter tous les 10 jours , ou tous les mois .
domage c'etait bien pratique
Fonctionne pour google, mais pas pour CalDAV... Pas terrible pour un logiciel libre...
Juste un bémols: pas synchronisation avec l'agenda d'un portable.
summary: simple et facile a prendre en main

description:
Sobre et efficace. 
Je l'utilise avec NextCloud, j'adore.
L'utilisation d'agenda d'un compte en ligne (nextcloud, gmail…) fonctionne, mais pas l'intégration d'un lien ical (ics).

Un agenda d'une finition parfaite qui s'intègre de manière parfaite dans Gnome avec lequel on peut synchroniser tous nos agendas cloud tels que Google Agenda pour l'avoir à la fois sur ordi et sur smartphone !
Ça marche juste super bien ! Rien à dire, tout est nickel !
summary: Une application parfaite comme il en existe peu de nos jours

description:
simple bonne finitions,
syncronisation avec un compte en ligne (nextcloud, microsoft, gmail…)
intégration de fihier ical (ics), mais par lien http
summary: simple, syncro compte en ligne et ical local, sauf ical par http

description:
Application que j'aimais énormément, simple, rapide, efficace.
Malheureusement depuis la mise à jour vers Fedora 32 et la version 3.36 les plantages sont devenus quotidiens, après modification d'un événement l'application quitte sans prévenir. PLUS GRAVE: on choisi une heure de démarrage pour un événement et Agenda décale d'une heure. J'ai loupé des rendez-vous à cause de cela !
très très bonne
Ce logiciel est appréciable pour sa simplicité et sa légèreté. Cependant, il plante très souvent dès qu'on veut faire une action un peu élaborée.
summary: simple et efficace mais plantages réguliers

description: Impossible de configurer une récurrence par exemple 1 fois tous les deux mois, 1 fois tous les 15 jours, etc.
summary: Ne permet pas une configuration fine des récurrences

description: application quasi inutile car en apporte beaucoup moind qu'une page web et utilise de l'espace disque

Le "drag and drop" d'un événement arrive au mauvais endroit ou n’apparaît pas.
Inqualifiable au XXIe siècle. N'embauchez pas le stagiaire qui a fait ça.
On peut importer un edt étudiant avec un lien, en plus de pouvoir ajouter d'autres évènements manuellement.
L'application cesse de fonctionne quand on essaye d'ajouter un calendrier externe.

Les changements ne fonctionnent pas tous... Les "notes" sont immodifiables, les rappels aussi. Seul le nom et les horaires peuvent être modifiés. Plantages lorsque l'on essaye de changer les calendriers.
summary: En consultation (lecture) oui... Les changements sont compliqués

description:
Design sympa.
Il manque le support CalDAV et la possibilité d'afficher les numéros de semaines.

Correcte dans l'ensemble si on ne cherche pas un calendrier complexe, dans la précédente version tout était plus facilement modifiable.
Vue de base simplifiée à l'extrême, par rapport à avant je perds beaucoup de temps pour créer mes RDV de patients. 
Le simple fait de ne pas pouvoir modifier l'heure des événements directement au clavier me fait regretter l'ancienne version. Attention au scroll de la souris, au risque de répéter votre événement à l'infini.
Le support CalDAV est présent mais seulement avec un compte synchronisé (via "Comptes en ligne").
summary: Moins bien que la précédente version

description: je recomande pas
Fonctionne très bien avec Nextcloud. Très facile à utiliser.
Simple et efficace

J'aime le design simple et élégant et la possibilité d'ajouter des comptes en ligne.

En revanche, il n'y a pas de possibilité de mettre manuellement les calendriers à jour. Le calendrier affiche des événements déjà supprimés, et des événements ajoutés récemment ne sont pas affichés.

Par ailleurs, je regrette profondément la décision de ne pas inclure les tâches dans le calendrier. Il reste impossible dans les applications Gnome d'avoir en un coup d'oeil les événements et les tâches de chaque jour, ce qui est vraiment dommage. Je resterai donc sur mon agenda Google :(
summary: Du potentiel mais des possibilités trop limitées. Pas de tâches !

description: bon ergonomie et intuitive

Le mieux est encore de ne pas ajouter d'agenda. Il fonctionne une fois et ne fonctionne plus ensuite. Ne permet plus la saisie d'évènement.... Le logiciel met un temps fou à s'ouvrir. Du grand n'importe quoi....
summary: Truffé de bug et non fonctionnel

description:
Comment peut-on sortir des programmes qui ne fonctionnent pas ??
Impossible de créer un agenda, impossible d'ajouter un évènement. Le programme met 20 secondes à s'afficher à l'écran sur une machine très performante...
Résultat lamentable. quel dommage
Ничего лишнего. Синхронизировать с другими календарями, не пробовал.
Быстрое и удобное.
я не знаю какое это приложение хорошее или плохое потомушто я ево не могу открыть пишут календарь не отвечает по этому 4 звезды но я думаю что приложение хорошое
Думаю ,что создал напоминание, в указанное времяникаких сообщений не было.

1. Не хватает синхронизации с outlook.
2. Не хватает возможности вывести на печать.
3. Не хватает просмотра недели без выходных.
4. Не хватает "альтернативного" представления недели (по вертикали в 2 столбика).
Некая anna писала про отсутствие синхронизации с outlook. Хочу обратьтить внимание Анны, что это календарь для Линукса, а outlook - это майкрософт гребаный. Хотя для Анны видимо это по фиг
Бумажный календарик функциональнее.
summary: Полный шлак - напоминания не работают от слова "никак"

description: App can't load and use iCal ICS/VCS files, but system sends that ics to it. A little crazy implementation and need to use another application.
Однозначно, удобное приложение.

Простой и функциональный календарь, поддерживающий синхронизацию с сетевыми учётными записями - можно отображать дни рождения контактов и другие календари из iCloud и Google, а также прикрутить своё облако OwnCloud/NextCloud.

Приложение хорошее, с google-календарем синхронизировать удалось, одно мальнокое НО. Если есть возможность вынести кнопку синхронизации на видное место и настроить режимы автоматической сихронизации (сам не нашел)
постоянно подтупливает синхронизация с разными аккаунтами
Удобно, что выводится информация по нажатию на дату в строке состояния.
summary: Удобный календарь, синхронизируется с гуглом, подтягивает напоминания

description: Работает. Хорошо все.
Best calendar manager for gnome
summary: Отличный календарь, на gnome 43 выглядит суперски!

description:
Пользовался только вкладкой "Год"!
Без неё стал бесполезен
Жаль!

Хотелось бы дни недели по вертикали и вывод каленаря на рабочий стол! Вот это было бы супер!
Спасибо!
Добавьте возможность экспорта календарей, очень не хватает.
на минт 20 не синхиртся с гугл календарем
summary: на минт 20 не синхиртся с гугл календарем

description: Надеюсь исправят, но на данный момент из-за него может попросту зависнуть оболочка.
在月尺度上的拖动和日期设置有大问题，每次设置12号会往回一天，而且拖动的时候，好像拖动的点不对劲
添加天气后，每次打开日历要等很久才能加载出天气信息。添加活动每次都不能提醒，提示有bug需要上传。
很简洁，同步功能不太好用的样子
summary: 为什么添加了在线账号，日历不能同步？

description: 我用了很长时间，对我很有帮助。

可以设定事件和弹窗提醒，界面比较好用。
个人简单需求足够了。
最好能合入万年历功能，或者做成插件的功能
summary: 最好能合入万年历功能，或者做成插件的功能

description: 没有农历很不方便, 也没找到相关的插件.
微软账号不能同步日历 我也就不知道同步什么了，要自己设置ics 然后好像我设置的时区有点问题，导致日历是有问题的
summary: 微软账号不能同步日历 我也就不知道同步什么了
